item.title: Toward understanding Bayesian Learning
item.description: Motivation Every statistic course I ever studied start with Simple Linear Regression. A linear regression problem can be state as following $$ \begin{aligned} y(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{w}) &= \sum_{j=0}^{M-1}{ w_j \phi_j(\mathbf{x}) = \mathbf{w}^\top \phi(\mathbf{x}) } \end{aligned} $$ def f(): return Theory Implementation

item.title: About
item.description: I am 29 (as of 2022). My undergrad was Economics at a local university, and I am going back to school so I can pursue higher education in the field of Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.
